meanings.definition: Lively and noisy festivities, especially involving drinking and dancing.
meanings.sent1: The town square was filled with revelry as people danced and sang.
meanings.sent2: The New Year's Eve party was full of revelry and laughter.
meanings.sent3: The revelry at the wedding reception made everyone smile and clap along.
meanings.sent4: The revelry in the streets was like a symphony of joy and music.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter added to the revelry of the birthday celebration.

meanings.sent1: The revelry at the carnival could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The revelry of the victory parade echoed through the city streets.
meanings.sent3: The revelry of the family reunion was a mix of hugs and cheers.
meanings.sent4: The revelry of the festival was a whirlwind of colors and sounds.
meanings.sent5: The revelry of the holiday party was contagious, spreading joy to all.
